description:
Do you want to make tons of valuable connections and build a solid network?üíØ

Or maybe you even HATEüò° just the thought of networking because it seems intimidating, fake and hard to do?

We have always been told that ‚ÄúYOUR NETWORK is YOUR NET WORTH‚Äù, BUT have never been told how to actually make it to that point.
‚ÄúJust get out there‚Äù - is not really working anymore, right? üòä

WHAT IS THE WORKSHOP ABOUT?
We are going to give you a lot of ACTIONABLE TAKEAWAYS that you will be able to implement straight on the event.

Here is what is going to be covered:
1) How to understand whom you need to find?‚úîÔ∏è
2) Where to find them?‚úîÔ∏è
3) How to approach them?‚úîÔ∏è
4) How to get what you want?‚úîÔ∏è
5) How to double-down the ROI of every connection?‚úîÔ∏è

WHO IS THAT FOR?
- You want to find co-founders with the same vision ‚òëÔ∏è
- You want to find team members that share the same passion‚òëÔ∏è
- You want to find mentors to progress in life‚òëÔ∏è
- You want to have fun while connecting with others‚òëÔ∏è

No matter what you do, networking is a key skill you need to learn in order to be successful.

YOU CAN EXPECT THIS:
Printed materials, Worksheets, a loooooooot of activities and FUN. (not a boring presentation talk, we HATEüòà that too)-> all of that for FREE!

AND WE EXPECT YOUR PRESENCE! üòâ

description:
Wanna learn how to build an end-to-end data science project but don't know where to start?

Join us for to learn about Data Science methodology and get hands-on experience with different tools available on IBM Watson Studio for data preparation, creating models, creating dashboards and embedding AI into applications, all on one platform with minimal code. Build your own AI product recommendation engine for a supermarket!

About the Speakers:

Abeer Haroon
Abeer Haroon - a software developer, part of the IBM Developer Experience team. She has expertise in Data Science and AI. She engages with the developer communities in Dubai including student developers, startup developers and enterprise developers. She on-boards them onto new and emerging technologies.

Follow Abeer on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/abeer-haroon-757b71166/

Prerna Bhojwani
Prerna Bhojwani is a software developer and works as a Developer Advocate at IBM. She engages with developers across enterprise, startup and open source and on-boards them onto the IBM Cloud platform. She has worked on several projects specializing in AI, Blockchain, Cloud and Data Science and codes primarily in Python.

Follow Prerna on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/prernabhojwani/

Agenda:

6:00-6:10 Meet & Greet / Evening snacks
6:10-6:40 Data Science Methodology & Essential Data Science Tools.
6:40-7:00 Scaling up your AI Operations with AutoAI & Watson OpenScale.
7:00-7:45 Code Lab - Build an end-to-end data science project for an AI recommendation engine
7:45-8:00 Q&A/Wrap up

Session Level: Intermediate

Pre-requisites:
1. The audience should have basic understanding of machine learning algorithms and how each is built ‚Äì they may not have to be able to code.
2. Have an IBM Cloud account (can sign up here): https://ibm.biz/aiengine
3. Bring a laptop

description:
So, you have a business that is doing ok and not sure what's the most (cost) effective way to grow it?

Growth Hacking is all about identifying the right strategy, channels & tools for each stage of your funnel while leveraging what has already worked. Once you crack the right combination you will experience true exponential growth!

In this intro to Growth Hacking free class, Samer Bejjani will be explaining the fundamentals of Growth Hacking, how it actually works & the mechanisms behind it - and no, it's not about sending 1000 emails and waiting for PR to work its magic, actually if you do it right you'll be chased by the press to share your story.

Agenda:
- What is Growth Hacking
- Conditions, requirements & mechanisms
- The growth funnel
- Growth Hacking strategies & regional success stories
- How Samer got 10,000 users without a budget using only GH
- Q&A

This class is in anticipation of the full 6-hours practical Growth Hacking workshop at AstroLabs Academy where you will deep dive AND build your own growth strategy with real-life mentorship and guidance.

Details about the workshop: https://academy.astrolabs.com/course/growth-hacking-dubai/

About the Speaker:
For the past 10 years, Samer Bejjani has worked with MENA based startups, leading Product, Tech, and Digital Marketing teams. He helped companies cut down their marketing budget by 5x, triple their conversion rates, founded and grew a social network to 10,000 users without a budget and mentored 20+ Dubai based startups.

He is currently Director of Product, Tech & Training at AstroLabs, was Chief Product Officer at Designer-24, the biggest omnichannel fashion rental platform in the region, and founded Hoodi, a neighborhood social network in Dubai.

description:
With our B.E.S.T(Build efficient scalable teams) model, we help companies from Dubai, Silicon Valley, and West Europe growing and scaling at the same time reducing development costs. The presentation can be useful for C-level people, management people or even developers to understand how multicultural company can work more efficient with proper processes without major changes inside an organization.

About the Speaker:
Mateusz Bosek
Former software engineer with 8 years of experience in the IT industry currently the leader of Hubranch ‚Äì a company that scales clients internal teams in Poland ‚Äì one of the most developed IT hubs in CEE.

He uses his extensive experience in relations with the regions of Western Europe and the Middle East(where he used to live) to lead Hubranch towards being a leader in building scalable internal teams in Poland.

His vision is to make Hubranch leading innovation centre in Poland and build a global campus where companies from different markets can work under one umbrella.

Follow Mateusz on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/mateusz-bosek-7a839663/

Meetup Agenda:
1. Overall scaling strategy
2. Recruitment process v.2
3. Why Poland is a good market to scale business?
4. B.E.S.T model
5. Types of legal entity
6. IT and academic collaboration in AI

Practical Takeaways:
Practical knowledge with proven numbers from the market

description:
Raising finances to fund your business, how to go about finding backers, engaging them and ensuring you are legally protected. A talk aimed at entrepreneurs looking to fund their company from start-up to series A.

About the Speaker:
David Linklater, Director of Accounting and CFO Services - Rethink
A seasoned chartered accountant with over 20 years‚Äô experience in managing private, public and PE/CV backed organisations. Valued for combining strategic planning with tactical delivery through change management, systems integration and performance measurement in a variety of industries including FMCG, Manufacturing, construction, e-commerce and hospitality.

Henzie Healley, Principal and Founder ‚Äì Beyond-Legal
Experienced New Zealand common law qualified and practising lawyer living in Dubai with private practice and in-house experience. Principal and Founder at Beyond-Legal LLC, a law firm handling a wide variety of corporate, commercial and other legally related matters. International, Corporate and Commercial Law.

Meetup Agenda:
1. The idea phase
2. The financial road map
3. Bootstrapping
4. Friends and family
5. Friends and family convertible debt
6. Angel Investors
7. Crowdfunding
8. Accelerators
9. Incubators
10. Venture Capital
11. Venture Capital v Private Equity
12. Getting pitch ready
13. The legalities of each

Practical Takeaways:
Raising finances to fund your business, how to go about finding backers, engaging them and ensuring you are legally protected. A talk aimed at entrepreneurs looking to fund their company from start-up to series A.

description:
This meetup is dedicated to both leaders of organizations responsible for digital transformation and young startup founders. I want to show you how many opportunities are overlooked by decision-makers or business owners while focusing on the transformation towards becoming a "Data‚Äù organization. There's no need to invest heavily in AI/Big Data to leverage outstanding practices and solutions that will enable your business to surpass your competitors. The Holy Grail is "STRATEGIC PARTNERSHIPS", with existing or new partners who are leading the industry they operate in.

About the Speaker:
Szymon Chmielowiec - CEO at WroCode (Data Science and software company) and Business Advisor at Hubranch. I'm passionate about cutting edge technologies, such as AI and Big Data. I love to discuss how might look like our future digital world. The special topic that I always try to explain differently is related to the possibility of collaboration between individuals and machines. Thanks to this together with our business partners we build stable and highly-efficient surroundings which enable rising outstanding ideas.

Follow Szymon on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/szymon-chmielowiec/

Meetup Agenda:
1. Who are we?
2. What is the definition of digital transformation? (Expectations vs. Reality, The role of company leader (characteristics, attitudes))
3. How to make digital transformation easier?
4. Exclusive globalization

Practical Takeaways:
1. What do you need to be prepared for while you transform company towards becoming the Data organization
2. How to make this process easier
3. How to become an industry leader without internal AI department
4. How strategic partnerships will constitute the future competitive position of your companies

description:
With the Hedera Consensus Service, you can develop applications like stock markets, audit logs, stable coins, or new network services that require high throughput and decentralized trust. This is made possible by having direct access to the native speed, security, and fair ordering guarantees of the hashgraph consensus algorithm, with the full trust of the Hedera ledger.

About the Speaker:
Alec Otto - Director of Ambassador Programs @ Hedera Hashgraph

Follow Alec on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/alec-otto-28966b140/

NOTE: This meetup will be led by our Dubai ambassadors. They will each be sharing the presentation responsibility.

Meetup Agenda:
- Recap - What is Hedera Hashgraph?
- Hedera network overview
- Scaling Up
- How HCS works
- Use Cases

Practical Takeaways:
A better understanding of enterprise-grade distributed ledger solutions, and a look into one of the most unique DLT services ever seen by the DLT/Blockchain Community.

We'll have food, drinks, and plenty of time for discussion. See you there!

description:
AT√ñLYE's "Pop-up Meets" in Dubai continue exploring the creative landscape in the region. The first two events provided deep insight into the current needs, emotions, and aspirations of the creative professionals in Dubai and the surrounding area. The next edition of the event series will revolve around "User Experience Design" with the aim of meeting the larger surrounding community of creatives and core micro-communities around UX Design.

The event will present an opportunity to learn about and discuss the current state of affairs in human-centric design in the government level, in the private sector, and among the communities.

If you want to go beyond participating, represent your community, and share your experiences as an active member of the human-centred Design UAE (formerly UX UAE) community, we are inviting you to volunteer and participate in the discussion sessions. Send us a message via meetup chat and tell us about how you can contribute.

Program:
6:30 - 7:15: Networking
7:15 - 7:45: Shift & Share: An interactive and intimate session of sharing UX design learnings
7:45 - 8:30: What is happening in UX in government, business, and community levels? Experienced UXers working in the fields of Government and Private Sector, as well as a member of the Design Community, will share their own experiences.
8:30 - 9:00 - Networking and socializing!

Hope to see you there!

description:
Description:

Sales is a process sales teams in any company need to master. Particularly a startup.

Learn 6 highly effective techniques for Closing a Sale in just 100 Minutes.

There is nothing more frustrating for a sales person than when a potential sale falls through. Often this is beyond their control but there are also occasions when a different approach may yield a better result.

In this session, we will be covering six highly effective techniques and discuss them. We also explain the importance of remaining on the look-out for buying signals and using the technique that most suits the situation.

Agenda:

‚Ä¢ The sales process
‚Ä¢ Buying Signals
‚Ä¢ Closing Techniques
‚Ä¢ Which Closing Technique when?

Practical Takeaways:

At the end of this 100-minute Meetup you will be able to Identify 6 highly effective techniques for closing a sale. Select and use the closing technique that is most appropriate for the particular situation.

About the Speaker:

The Knowledge Brokers in association with Astrolabs are proud to bring to you another unmissable Meetup from our "Startup Essentials" series.

Steve (https://www.expertbase.org/49) is an outstanding sales and communication coach with over 15 years of experience who will be joining us from Glasgow, UK.

Contact Mark from The Knowledge Brokers for queries / enquires -
https://www.theknowledgebrokers.com/contact
